comment.text: This translation key is used to display the phrase "{{productName}} owner" in various UI contexts. It appears on user profiles and other views related to ownership, indicating whether a user has full access or not.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "{{productName}}-ի տնօրինող" while conveying 'owner', might not be the most natural or idiomatic way to express it in Armenian. 'Տնօրինող' is more formal and typically refers to a manager or executive, not necessarily the simple 'owner'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider alternatives like "{{productName}}-ի սեփականատեր" (sepackanater) which more directly translates to 'owner' or investigate more context-specific Armenian equivalents for 'owner' depending on the product and target audience. A more colloquial option might also be appropriate.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Proprietário do {{productName}}' is a literal translation and might not be the most natural phrasing in Portuguese. '{{productName}} owner' implies possession or responsibility. A more natural translation would be 'Responsável pelo {{productName}}' or 'Gestor do {{productName}}'.

The Serbian (Cyrillic) translation "{{productName}} власник" uses the word 'власник' which translates to 'owner' but isn't the most natural phrasing in this context.  While technically correct, a more idiomatic translation might be needed depending on the overall tone and usage of 'PortalOwner'.  Consider options like '{{productName}} оператер' (operator) or '{{productName}} управител' (manager) depending on the nuance.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider alternative translations like '{{productName}} оператер' or '{{productName}} управител' for a more natural flow. The best option will depend on the specific product and desired meaning.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Serbian translation 'vlasnik' directly translates to 'owner' but may sound less natural in this context.  A more appropriate translation might consider phrasing like 'odgovorni za' (responsible for) or 'zadužen za' (in charge of), depending on the intended nuance of 'owner' in the original English.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider alternatives like 'odgovorni za {{productName}}' or 'zadužen za {{productName}}' for a more natural-sounding Serbian translation.
